title: Pain Assessment UI Components
description:
Create Pain Assessment Scale UI Components

Build interactive UI components for four standardized pain assessment scales, each with appropriate visual representations tailored to their specific measurement approach.

Requirements:
- Implement NRS (Numeric Rating Scale) component:
  * Display 0-10 numeric scale with clickable points
  * Include visual slider or button grid interface
  * Show selected value prominently
  
- Implement Wong-Baker FACES component:
  * Display 6 face icons representing pain levels 0-10
  * Ensure faces are clearly distinguishable and age-appropriate
  * Allow selection by clicking on face icons
  
- Implement PAINAD (Pain Assessment in Advanced Dementia) component:
  * Create form for 5 observational categories (breathing, vocalization, facial expression, body language, consolability)
  * Each category scored 0-2
  * Display total score (0-10) with automatic calculation
  
- Implement FLACC (Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability) component:
  * Create form for 5 behavioral categories
  * Each category scored 0-2 with descriptive criteria
  * Display total score (0-10) with automatic calculation

General specifications:
- Each component should be self-contained and reusable
- Include clear labels and instructions for each scale
- Ensure accessibility (keyboard navigation, screen reader support)
- Make components responsive for mobile and desktop
- Validate inputs and handle edge cases (no selection, incomplete forms)
- Follow consistent styling and interaction patterns across all scales
- Consider adding tooltips or help text explaining when each scale is appropriate to use
